Post_Title: Pride is claimed to be a sin, yet god himself is the most prideful one
post_text:
Why is it a sin to be prideful when god is the most prideful being imaginable?

Wants everyone to submit to him and be lower than him, created a universe of beings lower than him just to entertain his pride.

Those who do not submit suffer eternal punishment. 

He wants servants, also it seems as if he wants to punish those who do not serve him, since if he didn't want that he simply wouldn't create sin.

I never asked to be created I never consented to this. It is either bow your head or perish, and he made me this way as everything is supposedly by his will.

Hell, even satan, who was created by god was created with the flaw of pride, a sense of self. Since god doesn't make mistakes that can only mean it was on purpose. Meaning that he created satan in a way that will betray him. What is the purpose of this if not to entertain his pride/superiority.

In my opinon non-existance is much more merciful than existance.

Threads.Reply_Text:
You may be on the way... I had similar thoughts to your last line in the days  or weeks before God saved me, out of the blue, out of the darkness, into His glorious light.

God can't help but be the greatest. It's not a sin for the champions to sing, "We are the champions." It's not wrong for the greatest to be the greatest.

God promotes Himself because it is right and He is the best thing for us.

God orchestrated the fall of Lucifer and the fall of man so His myriad attributes would all be on display, for His great glory and our joy to witness and worship them.
